byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Karam Shoumali from Karkamis, Turkey; Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul; Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; Eric Schmitt from Washington; and Sabrina Tavernise from Jaffrey, N.H.

lead_paragraph: The failed coup in Turkey and the purge that followed appear to have enhanced President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s control of the military.

headline.print_headline: Syria Operation Points to a Shift in Turkey
headline.main: With Operation in Syria, Erdogan Shows His New Power Over Turkey’s Military

snippet: The failed coup in Turkey and the purge that followed appear to have enhanced President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s control of the military....
abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's decision to send military forces into Syria in aftermath of failed coup attempt indicates degree to which he has secured more operational control of country's military after purging it of coup supporters.
